paper_abstract: We study the asymptotic behavior of the number N-k,N-n of nodes of given degree k in unlabeled random trees, when the tree size n and the node degree k both tend to infinity. It is shown that N-k,N-n is asymptotically normal if ENk,n -> infinity and asymptotically Poisson distributed if ENk,n -> C > 0. If ENk,n -> 0, then the distribution degenerates. The same holds for rooted, unlabeled trees and forests. (c) 2006 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: Nodes of large degree in random trees and forests
